events.name: [Dev] AsiaVR Dev talks + Dev Jam
events.description:
Always wanted to create VR apps but don’t have the devices or the experience? Our solution to this is to put all the VR developers virtually and physically in one room. When you have a problem, just virtually or physically shout out your problem and someone will help you out. You can work on your own project or work on a new project by forming a group in the meetup. We also just setup the Green Screen for mixed reality video. You can shot your mixed reality video with this green screen.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O-OLXt6FJzQ For this VR Dev Jam, we will kick start the Dev Jam with Dev talks where developer share their experience developing VR apps so that we are well aware of all the libraries, know-how and who to ask for the Dev Jam. People that is new to VR is welcome! If you are too shy, you can always ask in our slack group. This is the link to our slack group. This is the link to our facebook group.  For now, we got • 1 HTC vive • 3 project tango • 2 oculus rift dk2 • A few Samsung GearVR • A few Cardboard • Maybe a few Oculus cv1 • Leap motions  Please let me know what VR devices you guys can bring to the Dev Jam in facebook or slack group 7.00 pm Dev talks AsiaVR Dev talks for developer or designer to share their experience and library that they uses to develop VR apps. • Basic gpu-shader programming in Unity in the context of mobile VR- Martin Eklund  • Developing VR for mobile. Lightbaking and Optimisation in Unity - Carleel from WoobaVR http://forum.unity3d.com/attachments/realtime_vs_baked-jpg.67755/ • User experience in VR game development - Jiang Kuo from Vito Technology • Developing HTC vive apps with NewtonVR and Focal Point VR open source library - Jia Hen from VRcollab  • Asset management + Shader Management with Shader Forge - Ye from Vito Technology  • Quick rundown of Unreal Engine 4 + Oculus DK2 with a game demo- Klexian  8.30pm - Present the project plan for the weekend 9.00 pm - Form team HACK! Because we have limited VR headsets, we will set up a few main computer with file system sharing or git. You just need develop in your laptop and send the executable or git push to the main computer to run it. We got 2 PC with 970 graphic card in our office, but we need more. Anyone willing to bring their VR ready desktop to the Dev Jam? Sunday 3 pm - Present! Whoever that present will get Swag from google. Note: This event is not for people to come and test the VR headset only. You can come to our AsiaVR meetup for that. Because we got limited space. We will cap the event to 30 people. 


For people that is in waiting list. You are welcome to come for the dev talks and see if we got space for you to join us for Dev Jam
events.group_name: AsiaVR Association - Singapore Virtual Reality meetup

events.name: Bar.Foo #2
events.description: Like Kopi.JS but with alcohol. Bar.Foo is a casual meet up with no agenda, rhyme or reason other than to chat with local developers and designers. Bring a friend or meet some new ones! This time, we're at OverEasy in Orchard: http://www.overeasy.com.sg/
events.location: Overeasy at Liat Towers, Liat Towers, 541 Orchard Road, Singapore
